policies.name: Incident Response Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing incident handling capability including preparation, detection, analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery phases
policies.rationale: NIST 03.06.01 requires 'an incident-handling capability that is consistent with the incident response plan' which necessitates a formal policy framework

policies.name: Contingency Planning Policy
policies.description: Policy governing coordination between incident response and business continuity activities
policies.rationale: Control requires 'coordinate incident handling activities with contingency planning activities' necessitating formal policy coordination

procedures.name: Incident Detection and Analysis Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for identifying and analyzing potential security incidents from various sources (audit logs, network monitoring, user reports)
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'detection and analysis' as core incident handling capability

procedures.name: Incident Containment Procedure
procedures.description: Process for containing identified incidents to prevent further damage, including isolation techniques and communication protocols
procedures.rationale: Control explicitly requires 'containment' as part of incident handling capability

procedures.name: Incident Eradication and Recovery Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for removing threat actor presence, eliminating vulnerabilities, and restoring systems to normal operations
procedures.rationale: Control explicitly requires 'eradication and recovery' phases in incident handling

procedures.name: Lessons Learned Procedure
procedures.description: Process for conducting post-incident reviews, documenting findings, and incorporating improvements into IR procedures, training, and testing
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'incorporate lessons learned from ongoing incident handling activities into incident response procedures, training, and testing'

executionEvidence.name: Incident Handling Records
executionEvidence.description: Detailed incident tickets/logs showing: incident ID, detection date/time, analysis findings, containment actions taken, eradication steps, recovery activities, personnel involved, time spent in each phase
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates execution of all phases of incident handling capability required by NIST control

executionEvidence.name: Lessons Learned Reports
executionEvidence.description: Post-incident review documents showing: incident summary, root cause analysis, response effectiveness assessment, identified improvements, action items assigned, updates made to procedures/training/testing
executionEvidence.rationale: Control explicitly requires incorporating lessons learned; quarterly aligns with NIST SP 800-61 best practices for IR program review

executionEvidence.name: IR-Contingency Planning Coordination Records
executionEvidence.description: Meeting notes or coordination documents showing interaction between incident response team and contingency planning team, shared resources, coordinated activities
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires coordination between incident handling and contingency planning activities

executionEvidence.name: Incident Response Capability Testing Evidence
executionEvidence.description: Records from periodic tests showing all phases exercised: preparation materials, detection scenarios, analysis results, containment effectiveness, eradication verification, recovery validation
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates ongoing capability to execute all required incident handling phases per NIST SP 800-61 guidance

operationalActivities: Monitor multiple sources for potential incidents (audit logs, network monitoring, physical access, user reports, supply chain events)
Detect and analyze security incidents using established criteria
Contain identified incidents to prevent further damage
Eradicate threat actor presence and eliminate vulnerabilities
Recover affected systems to normal operations
Coordinate incident response activities with contingency planning team
Conduct post-incident reviews and document lessons learned
Update incident response procedures based on lessons learned
Update incident response training content based on lessons learned
Incorporate lessons learned into incident response testing scenarios

controls.controlTitle: Incident Monitoring, Reporting, and Response Assistance

policies.name: Incident Reporting Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy defining reportable incidents, reporting timeframes, internal and external reporting authorities, and reporting requirements
policies.rationale: NIST 03.06.02 requires reporting to 'organization-defined authorities' and 'within organization-defined time period' which necessitates formal policy defining these parameters

policies.name: Incident Response Support Policy
policies.description: Policy establishing help desk, assistance groups, or support resources for users to report and receive guidance on incidents
policies.rationale: Control requires 'provide an incident response support resource' which necessitates formal policy establishing this capability

procedures.name: Incident Tracking and Documentation Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for recording incidents in ticketing system, maintaining incident status, documenting forensic details, tracking trends
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'track and document system security incidents' with 'records about each incident, status, and pertinent information for forensics'

procedures.name: Incident Reporting Procedure
procedures.description: Process for reporting suspected incidents internally within required timeframe and externally to designated authorities (law enforcement, US-CERT, regulatory bodies)
procedures.rationale: Control requires reporting to authorities within defined timeframe; procedure implements specific reporting requirements

procedures.name: Incident Response Help Desk Procedure
procedures.description: Process for users to report potential incidents, receive guidance, and obtain assistance from IR support team
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'incident response support resource that offers advice and assistance to system users on handling and reporting incidents'

executionEvidence.name: Incident Tracking Records
executionEvidence.description: Incident management system records showing: incident ID, date/time reported, incident classification, current status, forensic details collected, assigned personnel, resolution status, trending analysis
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates continuous tracking and documentation as required by control; NIST discussion emphasizes maintaining records for forensics and trend analysis

executionEvidence.name: Incident Reports to Authorities
executionEvidence.description: Copies of incident reports submitted to internal IR capability and external authorities showing: incident details, submission timestamp, receiving authority, confirmation of receipt
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires reporting within organization-defined timeframe; evidence demonstrates compliance with reporting requirements

executionEvidence.name: Help Desk Support Records
executionEvidence.description: Help desk tickets showing: user incident reports, guidance provided, assistance rendered, escalation to IR team, resolution documentation
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates provision of incident response support resource as required; NIST discussion mentions help desks, assistance groups, automated ticketing systems

executionEvidence.name: Forensic Analysis Reports
executionEvidence.description: Detailed forensic investigations showing: evidence collected, chain of custody, analysis methodology, findings, preservation of evidence for legal proceedings
executionEvidence.freshnessThreshold: N/A - maintained indefinitely for legal purposes
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion emphasizes 'pertinent information necessary for forensics' as part of incident documentation

operationalActivities: Track all security incidents in centralized incident management system
Document incident details including status, timeline, and forensic information
Report suspected incidents to internal IR capability within defined timeframe
Report incidents to external authorities (law enforcement, regulators) as required
Maintain help desk or support resource for users to report incidents
Provide guidance and assistance to users on incident handling
Collect and preserve forensic evidence for investigation
Analyze incident trends and patterns
Escalate incidents to appropriate response teams
Track incident resolution and closure

policies.name: Incident Response Policy
policies.description: Overall IR policy that includes requirements for periodic testing of incident response capability at defined frequency
policies.rationale: NIST 03.06.03 requires testing 'at organization-defined frequency' which necessitates policy establishing this requirement

procedures.name: Incident Response Testing Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for conducting IR tests including checklists, tabletop exercises, simulations, and functional exercises to evaluate IR capability
procedures.rationale: Control requires testing effectiveness; NIST discussion specifies 'checklists, walk-through or tabletop exercises, and simulations' as testing methods

procedures.name: IR Test Results Analysis Procedure
procedures.description: Process for analyzing test results, measuring effectiveness using qualitative and quantitative data, identifying weaknesses, and documenting improvement recommendations
procedures.rationale: Control requires determining effectiveness; NIST discussion emphasizes using 'qualitative and quantitative data' to measure IR process effectiveness

executionEvidence.name: Incident Response Test Reports
executionEvidence.description: Comprehensive test documentation showing: test date, test type (checklist/tabletop/simulation), scenario tested, participants, test results, effectiveness measures (response time, decision quality, communication effectiveness), identified weaknesses, recommendations for improvement
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires periodic testing; annual frequency aligns with NIST SP 800-84 and industry standards for IR testing

executionEvidence.name: Tabletop Exercise Documentation
executionEvidence.description: Records from tabletop exercises showing: scenario description, participant list, discussion points, decisions made, gaps identified, action items assigned
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion specifically mentions 'walk-through or tabletop exercises' as testing method; demonstrates structured testing approach

executionEvidence.name: IR Simulation Results
executionEvidence.description: Simulation test results showing: simulated incident details, detection time, analysis accuracy, containment effectiveness, recovery time, coordination effectiveness, impact on operations
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion specifies 'simulations' as testing method and mentions 'determination of effects on organizational operations, assets, and individuals'

executionEvidence.name: IR Testing Improvement Actions
executionEvidence.description: Action plans showing: weaknesses identified from tests, assigned remediation activities, responsible parties, completion dates, verification of implementation
executionEvidence.rationale: Control aims to 'identify potential weaknesses or deficiencies'; evidence shows findings are addressed

operationalActivities: Conduct annual incident response testing using defined methodology
Perform tabletop exercises with IR team and stakeholders
Execute simulations of realistic incident scenarios
Evaluate IR effectiveness using checklists and assessment criteria
Measure response times and decision quality during tests
Assess impact of IR activities on organizational operations
Identify weaknesses and deficiencies in IR capability
Document test results with qualitative and quantitative data
Develop remediation plans for identified weaknesses
Track implementation of IR improvements from testing

policies.name: Incident Response Policy
policies.description: Overall IR policy that includes requirements for role-based IR training, training frequency, and training update requirements
policies.rationale: NIST 03.06.04 requires training 'within organization-defined time period' and 'organization-defined frequency' which necessitates policy establishing these parameters

procedures.name: Role-Based Incident Response Training Procedure
procedures.description: Process for delivering IR training tailored to user roles (general users: incident recognition and reporting; system administrators: incident handling; IR team: forensics, recovery, restoration)
procedures.rationale: Control requires training 'consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities'; NIST discussion specifies different content for users vs. administrators vs. responders

procedures.name: IR Training Content Update Procedure
procedures.description: Process for reviewing and updating training content based on IR plan testing, actual incidents, audit findings, system changes, or policy updates
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'review and update incident response training content' after defined events; NIST discussion lists specific events requiring updates

executionEvidence.name: IR Training Records by Role
executionEvidence.description: Training completion records showing: employee name, role, training date, training content covered (incident recognition for users, incident handling for admins, forensics for responders), assessment score, next training due date
executionEvidence.frequency: Upon hire, role change, and annually
executionEvidence.freshnessThreshold: For initial: 30 days of assuming IR role; For recurring: 18 months
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires training within defined period of assuming role and at defined frequency thereafter; annual recurring aligns with NIST SP 800-50

executionEvidence.name: User IR Training Certificates
executionEvidence.description: Training certificates for general users showing: completion of incident identification and reporting training, suspicious activity recognition, date completed
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion emphasizes 'users may only need to know how to recognize an incident or whom to call'; demonstrates basic IR awareness

executionEvidence.name: IR Team Training Records
executionEvidence.description: Advanced training records for IR team members showing: forensics training, data collection techniques, system recovery procedures, system restoration methods, reporting procedures, training completion dates
executionEvidence.frequency: Upon assuming IR role and annually
executionEvidence.freshnessThreshold: For initial: 30 days; For recurring: 18 months
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion specifies 'incident responders may receive specific training on data collection techniques, forensics, reporting, system recovery, and system restoration'

executionEvidence.name: IR Training Content Update Records
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: training content review date, trigger event (IR test, actual incident, audit finding, system change, policy update), updates made, approval date, distribution to trainers
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires training updates following organization-defined events; NIST discussion lists specific events: 'IR plan testing, response to actual incident, audit findings, law/policy changes'

operationalActivities: Provide IR awareness training to all users within 30 days of system access
Train users to recognize and report suspicious activities
Provide incident handling training to system administrators
Provide advanced forensics and recovery training to IR team members
Deliver role-appropriate IR training when personnel assume new IR responsibilities
Conduct recurring IR training annually for all roles
Provide IR training when system changes affect incident response procedures
Review IR training content annually and after significant events
Update training content following IR plan testing results
Update training content after actual incident response activities
Update training content based on audit or assessment findings
Update training content when laws, policies, or regulations change

policies.name: Incident Response Plan
policies.description: Comprehensive formal plan that serves as the authoritative policy document for incident response, containing roadmap, structure, organizational approach, reportable incident definitions, information sharing protocols, and designated responsibilities
policies.rationale: NIST 03.06.05 requires developing IR plan as the foundational document; this plan IS the primary policy governing all incident response activities

procedures.name: Incident Response Plan Development Procedure
procedures.description: Process for creating or updating IR plan to address all required elements: implementation roadmap, organizational structure, integration approach, incident definitions, metrics, resources, information sharing, and responsibilities
procedures.rationale: Control requires developing plan with specific elements; procedure ensures all required components are addressed

procedures.name: IR Plan Distribution Procedure
procedures.description: Process for distributing IR plan copies to designated personnel and organizational elements, including distribution list maintenance and acknowledgment tracking
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'distribute copies of the incident response plan to designated incident response personnel and organizational elements'

procedures.name: IR Plan Update and Review Procedure
procedures.description: Process for periodically reviewing IR plan, updating based on system/organizational changes or problems encountered, and communicating changes to designated personnel
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'update the incident response plan to address system and organizational changes or problems encountered during implementation, execution, or testing'

executionEvidence.name: Incident Response Plan Document
executionEvidence.description: Complete IR plan containing: implementation roadmap, IR capability structure and organization, organizational integration approach, reportable incident definitions, information sharing protocols, designated entity/personnel responsibilities, distribution list, approval signatures, version history
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires developing comprehensive plan; document demonstrates all required elements are addressed per NIST requirements

executionEvidence.name: IR Plan Distribution Records
executionEvidence.description: Distribution logs showing: recipient names/roles, distribution date, version distributed, acknowledgment of receipt, access controls for plan confidentiality
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires distributing to designated personnel; records demonstrate plan is disseminated to those who need it

executionEvidence.name: IR Plan Review and Update Records
executionEvidence.description: Review documentation showing: review date, reviewers, identified changes needed (system changes, organizational changes, problems encountered), updates made, approval of changes, change communication records
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires updating plan for changes or problems; records demonstrate ongoing plan maintenance and relevance

executionEvidence.name: IR Plan Protection Controls Documentation
executionEvidence.description: Access control settings, encryption status, storage location security, dissemination restrictions showing how IR plan is protected from unauthorized disclosure
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires 'protect the incident response plan from unauthorized disclosure' since it contains sensitive security information

executionEvidence.name: External Coordination Agreements
executionEvidence.description: MOUs, ISAs, or coordination agreements with external organizations (service providers, supply chain partners, law enforcement) for incident information sharing
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion emphasizes 'coordination and sharing of information with external organizations, including external service providers and supply chain organizations'

operationalActivities: Develop comprehensive incident response plan addressing all required elements
Define what constitutes reportable incidents
Document IR capability structure and organization
Describe how IR capability integrates with overall organization
Establish protocols for sharing incident information internally and externally
Designate specific responsibilities to entities, personnel, and roles
Distribute IR plan to all designated incident response personnel
Distribute IR plan to relevant organizational elements
Review IR plan annually for needed updates
Update IR plan when system changes affect incident response
Update IR plan when organizational changes affect IR capability
Update IR plan based on problems encountered during IR activities
Protect IR plan from unauthorized disclosure with access controls
Maintain coordination agreements with external organizations
Communicate IR plan updates to designated personnel
